intro: Spermacoce aequabilis, commonly known as the common sida, is an annual herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect stems and small, white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny, smooth seeds. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in open habitats such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it a common weed in many agricultural areas.
